ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to conduct a thesis upon completion of data collection.
I learned how to write scientifically, how to analyze data, how to see patterns within data, and how to think logically to draw conclusions.
learning to conduct research independently and how to form and present a thesis paper and poster
Writing a scientific paper, getting to know my own research

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: More guidance directly from the DUS would be nice, but otherwise, the structure is good.

I think there could have been more communication, guidance, and involvement from the neuroscience department. Currently, I think students are under the impression that our PIs are the only ones who are reading our theses, so what's the point? Also, I think it would be cool to have a place where everyone could upload their theses for people to read. Maybe this could be an across-Yale thing.
maybe mandatory (or optional) one-on-one check ins with a DUS once a semester or once a year might both facilitate relationships and help students navigate their lab research
Not really a strength or weakness but there was no structure or guidance from the major.
I think there should be some monthly/bimonthly meeting to discuss progress or something.

I think it is very unstructured. This can be hard at the beginning. Perhaps providing some guidelines at the beginning of the semester, and more importantly at the beginning of the fall semester, on expectations and what this project should look like would be helpful. It was also immensely helpful in my case to work with a single person in the lab consistently.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I mean...you have no choice if you are a neuroscience major. Doing this class for the BS is definitely better than getting a BA.
yes, but it all depends on your lab I think

I would recommend this course (but then again, Neuro majors have to take this course). I would suggest that students pick their advisors and topics very carefully, such that they are working on a topic that is interesting to them and with an advisor who can guide them on the topic they would like to pursue.
